Surface Duo 是最近记忆中最大的硬件失败之一，但微软仍在继续推进该设备的续集，现在我们有了它的第一张可信图片。这里的故事有点奇怪。我们实际上不确定这些图片的来源（它们已与其他未经授权的内容一起上传到这个随机的 YouTube 频道），但 Windows Central 的 Zac Bowden 说这些图片是合法的，而且因为他在 Surface 方面有着无可挑剔的历史杜传言，他的肯定对我们来说已经足够了。鲍登称泄漏中展示的两个设备“接近最终原型”。图片中最明显的变化是设备背面的一个巨大的相机凸起。凸块包含三个摄像头，右侧看起来像一个 LED 闪光灯，还有一个传感器，可能是激光自动对焦，就在闪光灯下方。侧面的独立指纹读取器不见了（Windows Central 推测它将集成到电源按钮中），底部的 USB-C 端口现在居中。可悲的是，我们还不知道内部是什么样子。 Surface Duo 1 从来没有好的摄像头解决方案——事实上，它根本没有后置摄像头。摄像头是对手机机身厚度要求最大的之一（因此摄像头凸起），而 Surface Duo 是有史以来最薄的手机之一（每半只厚 4.8 毫米），根本没有空间容纳一个很好的相机。该设备只有一个低质量的前置摄像头，而且由于手机是可折叠的，因此它也可以作为后置摄像头发挥双重作用。不过，为 Duo 1 跳过后置摄像头并不是微软尝试的唯一解决方案——早期的原型展示了一个后置摄像头，在设备的另一半有一个相应的凹痕，允许原型 Duo 有一个后置摄像头仍然折叠平。这个 Duo 2 原型机有一个很大的相机凹凸，但另一侧没有草皮，所以看起来它不会折叠平？第一款 Duo 的一大卖点是 360 度铰链，并且可以根据需要在单屏模式下使用它，但似乎该功能正在受到影响。 Duo 1 的另一个问题是其奇怪且过时的规格表，但该设备的许多技术缺陷将在续集中得到修复。 Windows Central 表示这款手机将配备现代 SoC——Snapdragon 888——以及 NFC，这是 Duo 1 中更奇怪的遗漏之一。这款手机应该会在 9 月或 10 月的某个时候发货。 Surface Duo 1 是微软有史以来第一款自有品牌的 Android 手机，也是自诺基亚 Windows Phone 时代以来该公司首次推出智能手机。从各方面来看，Duo 1 都是一场灾难。在我们使用它的过程中，我们遇到了大量错误和明显的软件缺陷，例如其糟糕的键盘。但我们最大的收获是外形尺寸不起作用。即使折叠起来，Duo 1 也比市场上的任何其他设备都要宽得多，甚至比 Nexus 6 等历史悠久的大型手机还要宽 10 毫米，这使得握持或塞入口袋都不舒服。 Android 不能很好地扩展到超宽屏幕（高的很好，宽的不是），所以手机没有显示太多内容。两屏设计也不是那么引人注目。平板电脑或可折叠设备可以提供类似的并排应用程序操作，还可以为视频和平板电脑应用程序提供单个大屏幕的灵活性，这在分屏 Duo 上是不可行的。 Duo 也没有用于通知的前置屏幕，这是所有其他可折叠设备（如 Galaxy Fold 和 Flip、Moto Razr 以及小米和华为可折叠设备）的标准功能。当您的手机发出哔哔声时，您希望能够瞥一眼它以查看通知，而不必用两只手来打开和关闭设备。这些问题似乎都不会在续集中得到解决。 Surface Duo 在市场上也失败了，折扣几乎立即开始。今天，最高的 1,400 美元建议零售价降至近 1,000 美元。最热的甩卖看到 Duos 以 409 美元的价格被卸载，但今天，这些东西仅仅以 419 美元的价格在亚马逊仓库里闲逛，它们仍然没有卖完。你会认为像 Duo 1 这样严重的市场失利会导致续集发生巨大的变化，但微软似乎并没有被吓倒。
该公司至少可以修复 Duo 1 附带的一些有问题的软件和过时的硬件。但是如果您以前不是这个概念的粉丝，那么 Duo 2 并没有试图做太多改变你的心。
note_en:
The Surface Duo was one of the biggest hardware flops in recent memory, but Microsoft is still charging ahead with a sequel to the device, and now we have the first credible pictures of it. The story here is kind of weird. We're not actually sure where the pictures are from (they've been uploaded to  this random YouTube channel with other uncredited content), but  Windows Central's Zac Bowden says the images are legit, and since he has had an impeccable history of nailing Surface Duo rumors, his affirmation is good enough for us. Bowden calls the two devices shown off in the leak "near-final prototypes."
 The most obvious change in the pictures is a huge camera bump on the back of the device. The bump houses three cameras, along with what looks like an LED flash to the right and one more sensor, perhaps laser autofocus, just below the flash. The standalone fingerprint reader on the side is gone (Windows Central speculates it will be integrated into the power button), and the USB-C port on the bottom is now centered. Sadly, we don't know what the inside looks like yet.
 The Surface Duo 1 never had a good camera solution—in fact, it didn't have a rear camera at all. Cameras are one of the biggest thickness demands on a phone body (hence the camera bumps), and the Surface Duo, being one of the thinnest phones ever made (at only 4.8 mm thick for each half), simply didn't have room for a good camera. The device only got one low-quality front camera, and since the phone was foldable, it could pull double-duty as a rear camera, too.
  Skipping out on a rear camera for the Duo 1 wasn't the only solution Microsoft tried, though—early prototypes showed a rear camera with a corresponding divot on the other half of the device, allowing the proto-Duo to have a rear camera bump and still fold flat. This Duo 2 prototype has a big camera bump but no divot on the other side, so it looks like it won't fold flat? A big selling point of the first Duo was the 360 hinge and the ability to use it in single-screen mode if you wanted, but it seems like that feature is being compromised. Another problem with the Duo 1 was its weird and out-of-date spec sheet, but many of the device's technical shortcomings will be fixed in the sequel. Windows Central says the phone will ship with a modern SoC—the  Snapdragon 888—along with NFC, one of the more bizarre omissions of the Duo 1. The phone should ship sometime in September or October.
     The Surface Duo 1 was Microsoft's first-ever self-branded Android phone and the company's first swing at a smartphone since the Nokia Windows Phone days. By all accounts, the Duo 1 was a disaster. In  our time with it, we experienced a ton of bugs and glaring software deficiencies, like its poor keyboard. But our big takeaway was that the form factor didn't work. Even when folded up, the Duo 1 was significantly wider than any other device on the market, eclipsing even historically huge phones like the Nexus 6 by 10 mm, which made it uncomfortable to hold or shove into a pocket. Android doesn't scale well to ultra-wide screens (tall is fine, wide is not), so the phone didn't show much content.
 The two-screen design also wasn't that compelling. A tablet or foldable can offer similar side-by-side app action and also provide the flexibility of a single big screen for videos and tablet apps, which isn't viable on the split-screen Duo. The Duo also didn't have a front screen for notifications, which is a standard feature on every other foldable device like the Galaxy Fold and Flip, the Moto Razr, and the Xiaomi and Huawei foldables. When your phone beeps, you want to be able to glance at it to see the notification without having to use two hands to open and close the device. It does not seem like any of these issues will be addressed in the sequel.
 The Surface Duo was a failure in the market, too, with discounts starting nearly immediately. Today, the sky-high $1,400 MSRP is down to almost $1,000 off. The hottest fire sale saw Duos being unloaded for  $409, but today, these things are just sitting around  in Amazon warehouses for $419, and they still aren't selling out. You would think that a serious market flop like the Duo 1 would lead to dramatic changes in the sequel, but Microsoft does not seem deterred.
 The company can at least fix some of the buggy software and out-of-date hardware it shipped with the Duo 1. But if you weren't a fan of the concept before, the Duo 2 isn't trying to do much to change your mind.
title: 这是第一个可信的 Microsoft Surface Duo 2 泄漏
title_en: Here’s the first credible Microsoft Surface Duo 2 leak

note: 我们已经看到可以发现脑肿瘤的头盔和人工智能，但一种新的安全帽实际上也可以治疗它们。作为最新神经学突破的一部分，研究人员使用头盔产生磁场将致命肿瘤缩小三分之一。接受治疗的 53 岁患者最终因无关的伤害去世。但是，对他的大脑进行的尸检显示，该手术在短时间内切除了 31% 的肿瘤块。该测试标志着第一种针对称为胶质母细胞瘤的致命脑癌的无创疗法。头盔的特点是三个旋转磁铁连接到一个由可充电电池操作的基于微处理器的电子控制器。作为治疗的一部分，患者在诊所佩戴该设备五周，然后在妻子的帮助下回家。头盔产生的磁场疗法最初进行了两个小时，然后逐渐增加到每天最多六个小时。在此期间，患者的肿瘤质量和体积缩小了近三分之一，缩小似乎与治疗剂量相关。该设备的发明者——获得了 FDA 的同情使用治疗——声称它有朝一日可以帮助治疗脑癌，而无需放疗或化疗。 “我们的结果……开启了一个无创和无毒治疗的新世界……未来有许多令人兴奋的可能性，”通讯作者兼肯尼斯·R·皮克脑和垂体肿瘤治疗中心主任大卫·巴斯金说。休斯顿卫理公会神经病学研究所神经外科系。该程序的详细信息已发表在同行评审的肿瘤学前沿杂志上。
note_en:
We’ve seen  helmets and  AI that can spot brain tumors, but a new hard hat can actually treat them, too. As part of the latest neurological  breakthrough, researchers used a helmet that generates a magnetic field to shrink a deadly tumor by a third. The 53-year-old patient who underwent the treatment ultimately passed away due to an unrelated injury. But, an autopsy of his brain showed that the procedure had removed 31 percent of the tumor mass in a short time. The test marked the first noninvasive therapy for a deadly form of brain cancer known as glioblastoma.
 The helmet features three rotating magnets connected to a microprocessor-based electronic controller operated by a rechargeable battery. As part of the therapy, the patient wore the device for five weeks at a clinic and then at home with the help of his wife. The resulting magnetic field therapy created by the helmet was administered for two hours initially and then ramped up to a maximum of six hours per day. During the period, the patient’s tumor mass and volume shrunk by nearly a third, with shrinkage appearing to correlate with the treatment dose.
 The inventors of the device — which received FDA approval for compassionate use treatment — claim it could one day help treat brain cancer without radiation or chemotherapy. “Our results…open a new world of non-invasive and nontoxic therapy…with many exciting possibilities for the future,” said David S. Baskin, corresponding author and director of the Kenneth R. Peak Center for Brain and Pituitary Tumor Treatment in the Department of Neurosurgery at Houston Methodist Neurological Institute. Details of the procedure have been published in the peer-reviewed journal  Frontiers in Oncology.
title: 磁性头盔在世界首次测试中缩小了致命的肿瘤
title_en: A magnetic helmet shrunk a deadly tumor in world-first test

note: 盖伊·雷菲特 (Guy Reffitt) 在参与骚乱三周后于 1 月下旬被捕，此后一直入狱。他对五项联邦指控表示不认罪，包括将枪支带到国会大厦和妨碍司法公正。他的 Windows 笔记本电脑是 FBI 没收的几台设备之一，调查人员称这些设备受密码保护，但也可以使用 Reffitt 的脸解锁。检察官说，法医证据表明，笔记本电脑包含了 Reffitt 戴头盔的相机的数千兆字节的镜头，据称他用这些相机记录了一些骚乱，并询问法院是否可以强迫 Reffitt 坐在电脑前解锁它。雷菲特的律师告诉法庭，他的当事人“不记得”密码，但法庭站在政府一边，批准了强制他进行生物识别的动议。雷菲特的律师告诉首先报道法院命令的 CNN，笔记本电脑现已解锁。政府利用了第五修正案的漏洞，这是一项宪法权利，赋予美国任何人保持沉默的权利，其中包括不交出可能涉及犯罪的信息的权利，例如密码。但一些法院裁定，这些保护措施不能扩展到可以用来代替密码的人的身体特征，例如面部扫描或指纹。在 Reffitt 的起诉书中，联邦调查局如是说，认为迫使 Reffitt 坐在电脑前解锁他的电脑“不会违反被告的第五修正案禁止自证其罪的权利”。美国各地的法院在第五修正案的解读以及它是否适用于强制使用个人生物识别技术方面仍然存在分歧。美国最高法院不太可能在短期内解决这个问题，在多年内驳回了两份对此事作出裁决的请愿书，主要由各州来决定。
note_en:
Guy Reffitt was arrested in late January, three weeks after he participated in the riot, and has been in jail since. He has pleaded not guilty to five federal charges, including bringing a firearm to the Capitol grounds and a charge of obstructing justice. His Windows laptop was one of several devices seized by the FBI, which investigators said was protected with a password, but that it could also be unlocked using Reffitt’s face.
 Prosecutors said forensic evidence suggested that the laptop contained gigabytes of footage from Reffitt’s helmet-worn camera that he allegedly used to record some of the riot, and asked the court if it could compel Reffitt to sit in front of the computer to unlock it.
 Reffitt’s lawyer told the court that his client could “not remember” the password, but the court sided with the government and  granted the motion to compel his biometrics. Reffitt’s lawyer told CNN, which  first reported the court order, that the laptop is now unlocked.
 The government took advantage of a loophole in the Fifth Amendment, a constitutional right that grants anyone in the U.S. the right to remain silent, which includes the right to not turn over information that could implicate themselves in a crime,  such as a password. But some courts have ruled that those protections don’t extend to a person’s physical attributes that can be used in place of a password, such as a face scan or fingerprint.
 In Reffitt’s indictment, the FBI said as such, arguing that compelling Reffitt to unlock his computer by sitting in front of it “would not run afoul of the defendant’s Fifth Amendment right against self-incrimination.”
 Courts across the U.S. are still divided on the reading of the Fifth Amendment and whether or not it applies to the compelled use of a person’s biometrics. The U.S. Supreme Court isn’t likely to address the issue any time soon, rejecting two petitions in as many years to rule on the matter, leaving it largely up to the states to decide.
title: 法院命令美国国会暴徒“用脸”解锁他的笔记本电脑
title_en: Court orders US Capitol rioter to unlock his laptop ‘with his face’

布鲁塞尔，7 月 26 日（路透社） - 欧盟委员会周一表示，法国、西班牙、意大利和其他 20 个欧盟国家可能会因拖延将具有里程碑意义的欧盟版权规则纳入国内法而被告上法庭，并要求该组织解释延误。两年前通过的版权规则旨在确保欧盟数万亿欧元的创意产业与 Alphabet (GOOGL.O) 旗下的谷歌 (GOOGL.O) 和 Facebook (FB.O) 等在线平台之间的公平竞争环境。然而，一些欧洲的艺术家和广播公司仍然不高兴，特别是对关键条款第 17 条的解释，该条款旨在强制 YouTube 和 Instagram 等共享平台过滤受版权保护的内容。欧盟委员会表示，它已向国家集团发出正式通知函，这是其侵权诉讼的第一步，要求作出解释。制定欧盟规则的截止日期是 6 月 7 日。 其他国家是奥地利、比利时、保加利亚、克罗地亚、塞浦路斯、捷克共和国、丹麦、爱沙尼亚、希腊、芬兰、爱尔兰、立陶宛、卢森堡、拉脱维亚、波兰、葡萄牙、罗马尼亚、瑞典、斯洛文尼亚和斯洛伐克。他们有两个月的时间对委员会作出回应或收到警告，称为合理意见。下一步是转介至位于卢森堡的欧盟最高法院。欧盟执行官还表示，它已要求法国、西班牙和其他 19 个欧盟国家解释为什么他们错过了 6 月 7 日的最后期限，为广播和电视节目的在线传输制定单独的版权规则。
其他国家包括奥地利、比利时、保加利亚、克罗地亚、塞浦路斯、捷克共和国、爱沙尼亚、希腊、芬兰、爱尔兰、意大利、立陶宛、卢森堡、拉脱维亚、波兰、葡萄牙、罗马尼亚、斯洛文尼亚和斯洛伐克。
note_en:
BRUSSELS, July 26 (Reuters) - France, Spain, Italy and 20 other EU countries may be taken to court for their tardiness in enacting landmark EU copyright rules into national law, the European Commission said on Monday as it asked the group to explain the delays.
 The copyright rules, adopted two years ago, aim to ensure a level playing field between the European Union's trillion-euro creative industries and online platforms such as Google, owned by Alphabet  (GOOGL.O), and Facebook  (FB.O).
 Some of Europe's artists and broadcasters, however, are still not happy, in particular over the interpretation of a key provision, Article 17, which is intended to force sharing platforms such as YouTube and Instagram to filter copyrighted content.
 The Commission said it had sent letters of formal notice, the first step of its infringement proceedings, to the countries group asking for explanations. The deadline for enacting the EU rules was June 7.
 The other countries are Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Croatia, Cyprus, the Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Greece, Finland, Ireland, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Latvia, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Sweden, Slovenia and Slovakia.
 They have two months to respond to the Commission or receive a warning, known as a reasoned opinion. The next step is a referral to the EU's top court in Luxembourg.
 The EU executive also said it had asked France, Spain and 19 other EU countries to explain why they missed a June 7 deadline to enact separate copyright rules for online transmission of radio and TV programmes.
 The other countries are Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Croatia, Cyprus, the Czech Republic, Estonia, Greece, Finland, Ireland, Italy, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Latvia, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Slovenia and Slovakia.
title: 欧盟委员会就版权规则对 23 个欧盟国家提起法律诉讼
title_en: European Commission Starts Legal Action Against 23 EU Countries Over Copyright Rules
